Package edu.sru.group3.WebBasedEvaluations.controller

Class ResetPasswordController

java.lang.Object
edu.sru.group3.WebBasedEvaluations.controller.ResetPasswordController
@Controller public class ResetPasswordController extends Object
Class for controlling attempts at password resets such as recovery and first time logins
Author:
Dalton Stenzel

  • Method Details

    • resetPassword

      @GetMapping("/resetting") public String resetPassword(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Method called when the "Reset Password" button is pressed on the login page.
      Parameters:
      model - is a Model object for adding a resetPassword object to the page.
      Returns:

    • firstResetPassword

      @GetMapping("/firstReset") public String firstResetPassword(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth, @ModelAttribute ResetPassword reset, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Method called when a user logins in for the first time, based off a user's attribute (resetP).
      Parameters:
      auth - is an Authentication object used for identifying the person logged in.
      reset - is a ResetPassword object that is added to the webpage as an attribute.
      model - is a Model object for adding attributes to a webpage.
      Returns:
      recover_password_reset html webpage.

    • resetSent

      @PostMapping("/reset") public String resetSent(@ModelAttribute ResetPassword reset, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Method called upon clicking the "Submit" button on the recover password page with an email. The method puts together some Strings for a unique email with a particular token linked to the user with that email address in order only a person with that link to be able to reset the password. If the email does not exist in the database, then a message will display saying so.
      Parameters:
      reset - is a ResetPassword object that is grabbed from an attribute submitted by the page for evaluation.
      model - is a Model object for adding attributes to a webpage.
      Returns:
      reset html webpage

    • showChangePasswordPage

      @GetMapping("/changePassword") public String showChangePasswordPage(org.springframework.ui.Model model, ResetPassword reset, @RequestParam("token") String token)
      Method that is called on when the unique link that was generated from /reset is pressed. It checks if the token has expired or not. If the token has expired, then the user will be redirected to the login screen, otherwise another webpage will be displayed for the user to reset their password.
      Parameters:
      model - is a Model object used for adding attributes to a webpage. Mostly used for messages in this scenario
      reset - is a ResetPassword object that gets added to the webpage
      token - is a String that is unique to the email/url that is tied to a user's email in order to reset their password
      Returns:
      recover_password_reset html webpage or redirect to login

    • updateRecovery

      @PostMapping("/recoverChanges/{id}") public String updateRecovery(@PathVariable("id") long id, @ModelAttribute("user") User user, @ModelAttribute("reset") ResetPassword reset, @ModelAttribute("token") String token, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Method that gets called upon when pressing "Submit" after entering a password twice when in the act of changing the password post email recovery link. The password will only update if the two password boxes match, have no spaces, and the size of the password is 5 characters or greater.
      Parameters:
      id - is a long that holds the id value of the user having their password changed.
      user - is a User object used to hold the user with the previously mentioned id for changes to occur.
      reset - is a ResetPassword object used to hold the data of the two password boxes on the page.
      token - is a String value that holds a unique set of characters that is associated to a user's email.
      model - is a Model object used for adding attributes to a webpage, most for messages in this instance.
      Returns:
      recover_password_reset html webpage.

    • emailSentConfirm

      @GetMapping("/email_sent") public void emailSentConfirm(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Method for sending messages to the webpage to confirm that an email was sent
      Parameters:
      model - is Model object used for adding attributes to a webpage. It's used for adding messages in this case.
